member.name: T:Waher.Persistence.Files.FilesProvider
member.summary: Persists objects into binary files.

member.name: M:Waher.Persistence.Files.FilesProvider.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Text.Encoding,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Persists objects into binary files.
member.param: Size of a block in the B-tree. The size must be a power of two, and should be at least the same size as a sector on the storage device. Smaller block sizes (2, 4 kB) are suitable for online transaction processing, where a lot of updates to the database occurs. Larger block sizes (8, 16, 32 kB) are suitable for decision support systems. The block sizes also limit the size of objects stored directly in the file. Objects larger than bytes will be stored as BLOBs.
Maximum number of blocks in in-memory cache. This cache is used by all files governed by the database provider. The cache does not contain BLOB blocks.
Size of a block in the BLOB file. The size must be a power of two. The BLOB file will consist of a doubly linked list of blocks of this size.
Encoding to use for text properties.
Timeout, in milliseconds, to wait for access to the database layer.
If the files should be encrypted or not.

member.summary: Number of bytes used by an Object ID.

member.name: P:Waher.Persistence.Files.FilesProvider.BlockSize
member.summary: Size of a block in the B-tree. The size must be a power of two, and should be at least the same size as a sector on the storage device. Smaller block sizes (2, 4 kB) are suitable for online transaction processing, where a lot of updates to the database occurs. Larger block sizes (8, 16, 32 kB) are suitable for decision support systems. The block sizes also limit the size of objects stored directly in the file. Objects larger than will be persisted as BLOBs, with the bulk of the object stored as separate files. Smallest block size = 1024, largest block size = 65536.

member.name: P:Waher.Persistence.Files.FilesProvider.BlobBlockSize
member.summary: Size of a block in the BLOB file. The size must be a power of two. The BLOB file will consist of a doubly linked list of blocks of this size.

member.name: T:Waher.Persistence.Files.ObjectBTreeFile
member.summary: This class manages a binary file where objects are persisted in a B-tree.

member.name: M:Waher.Persistence.Files.ObjectBTreeFile.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,Waher.Persistence.Files.FilesProvider,System.Text.Encoding,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: This class manages a binary file where objects are persisted in a B-tree.
member.param: Name of binary file. File will be created if it does not exist. The class will require unique read/write access to the file.
Name of collection corresponding to the file.
Name of file in which BLOBs are stored.

Size of a block in the B-tree. The size must be a power of two, and should be at least the same size as a sector on the storage device. Smaller block sizes (2, 4 kB) are suitable for online transaction processing, where a lot of updates to the database occurs. Larger block sizes (8, 16, 32 kB) are suitable for decision support systems. The block sizes also limit the size of objects stored directly in the file. Objects larger than bytes will be stored as BLOBs.
Size of a block in the BLOB file. The size must be a power of two. The BLOB file will consist of a doubly linked list of blocks of this size.
Encoding to use for text properties.
Timeout, in milliseconds, to wait for access to the database layer.
If the files should be encrypted or not.

member.summary: This class manages a binary file where objects are persisted in a B-tree.
member.param: Name of binary file. File will be created if it does not exist. The class will require unique read/write access to the file.
Name of collection corresponding to the file.
Name of file in which BLOBs are stored.

Size of a block in the B-tree. The size must be a power of two, and should be at least the same size as a sector on the storage device. Smaller block sizes (2, 4 kB) are suitable for online transaction processing, where a lot of updates to the database occurs. Larger block sizes (8, 16, 32 kB) are suitable for decision support systems. The block sizes also limit the size of objects stored directly in the file. Objects larger than bytes will be stored as BLOBs.
Size of a block in the BLOB file. The size must be a power of two. The BLOB file will consist of a doubly linked list of blocks of this size.
Encoding to use for text properties.
Timeout, in milliseconds, to wait for access to the database layer.
If the files should be encrypted or not.

member.name: P:Waher.Persistence.Files.ObjectBTreeFile.BlockSize
member.summary: Size of a block in the B-tree. The size must be a power of two, and should be at least the same size as a sector on the storage device. Smaller block sizes (2, 4 kB) are suitable for online transaction processing, where a lot of updates to the database occurs. Larger block sizes (8, 16, 32 kB) are suitable for decision support systems. The block sizes also limit the size of objects stored directly in the file. Objects larger than will be persisted as BLOBs, with the bulk of the object stored as separate files. Smallest block size = 1024, largest block size = 65536.

member.name: P:Waher.Persistence.Files.ObjectBTreeFile.BlobBlockSize
member.summary: Size of a block in the BLOB file. The size must be a power of two. The BLOB file will consist of a doubly linked list of blocks of this size.

member.name: T:Waher.Persistence.Files.Storage.SequentialGuidGenerator
member.summary: Class that generates sequential, albeit cyclical, GUIDs for use in databases. They are not guaranteed to be globally unique. They are however unique to a very high degree of probability.

member.name: M:Waher.Persistence.Files.Storage.SequentialGuidGenerator.#ctor
member.summary: Class that generates sequential, albeit cyclical, GUIDs for use in databases. They are not guaranteed to be globally unique. They are however unique to a very high degree of probability.

member.name: M:Waher.Persistence.Files.Storage.SequentialGuidGenerator.CreateGuid
member.summary:
GUIDs are generated by sets of 16 bytes, that are defined as follows:
Bytes 0-3: Number of seconds, since 2001-01-01. (Will wrap 2136-02-07, 06:28:16) Bytes 4-7: Counter, started at a random number. Bytes 8-9: Process ID. Bytes 10-12: Machine number. Bytes 13-15: Random number.
member.returns: New GUID

First value is true if the object that implements System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{string,object} contains an element with the specified key; otherwise, false. When this method returns, the second value associated with the specified key, if the key is found; otherwise, the default value for the type of the value parameter.
